Description: Fragment of part of rim and wall of East Greek pottery platel. On the interior, a lotus and bud frieze; rim area glazed black with added red and white bands. On the exterior, bands. The exterior may have been slipped, but the surface is very worn.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 28, no. 97 pl. 27)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.123)
